intro: Stachytarpheta sanguinea var. grisea, commonly known as gray stachy, is a variant of the genus Stachytarpheta, which belongs to the family Verbenaceae. It is characterized by its gray-green foliage and small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in whorls. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive silvery hue due to the presence of fine, powdery hairs. This variant is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
